intro: Lithocarpus finetii, commonly known as the Vietnamese stone栎, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture, contributing to its ecological significance in forest ecosystems.
